alert.note: Alert for Delaware Beaches (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued May 25 at 3:30PM EDT until May 25 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents are expected. * WHERE...The beaches of Delaware and New Jersey. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Strong rip currents and hazardous surf conditions. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore and into deeper water.
info.instruction: Do not enter the water as conditions in the surf are extremely dangerous. If you are ever caught in a rip current, relax and float. Do not swim against the current. If possible, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If you are unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
